title: Richmond, Alabama
text: Richmond, also known as Warrenton, is an <a href="unincorporated%20area">unincorporated community</a> in <a href="Dallas%20County%2C%20Alabama">Dallas County</a>, <a href="Alabama">Alabama</a>, United States. Richmond gained its name from <a href="Richmond%20County%2C%20New%20York">Richmond County, New York</a>, the birthplace for several early settlers, most notably the Crocherons. Richmond has one site included on the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a>, the <a href="Street%20Manual%20Training%20School">Street Manual Training School</a>. <a href="Elm%20Bluff%20Plantation">Elm Bluff Plantation</a>, owned by John Jay Crocheron, is nearby in <a href="Elm%20Bluff%2C%20Alabama">Elm Bluff</a>.
